modules.description: Parses rule specifications from strings or files, returning a structured representation of rules with left and right hand sides. Applies rules to facts to generate new facts and track partial matches, with methods to reset state and pretty-print rules. Handles error reporting with file context and detailed diagnostics.

Provides functions to parse and manipulate binary data using bit-level operations, including packing and unpacking integers, extracting bits, and shifting. Works with byte arrays, integers, and bitmasks to handle low-level data formatting. Used to implement network protocols and file format parsers requiring precise control over binary representations.

Processes rule specifications into structured rule objects, enabling pattern matching against facts and generating new facts through rule application. Supports variables, wildcards, and non-linear pattern matching using S-expressions and atoms. Can apply rules to streams of facts, track partial matches, and handle errors with contextual feedback. Examples include matching memory access patterns, inferring program behavior, and generating derived facts from raw binary data.
